name: Inna Ostrovsky
body:
### Contact me:
Phone: (650) 485-9088  
Email: inna01@outlook.com  
Linkedin: www.linkedin.com/pub/inna-ostrovsky/67/857/131/  
GitHub: @inna01  
Samples of my work: See Excel [Samples](#samples) below

### About Me
Talented and creative young professional with an exceptional academic background and professional credentials. I have a Financial and Business analyst experience and a solid knowledge of IT data manipulation and presentation skills as well as IT Audit and Processes. I am an expert in data orchestration and visual data representation techniques using Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Access, Tableau, and SQL and can deliver dynamic interactive dashboards that provide an engaging user experience. My passion is in data analytics and particularly in Finance and Business Intelligence areas. I’m currently looking for the opportunity to join a dynamic and smart team that encourages collaboration and values desire to learn and succeed.

### Skills
Technical Expertise
```
- Expert Microsoft Excel, Access, PowerPoint, and Visio (Pivot tables, Macros, VBA, VLookup)
- SQL, Tableau, and Relational Databases
- Basic Unix and Linux OS skills (including Bash scripting)
- Git, GitHub, GitHub Pages, GitHub markdown
- Excellent knowledge of XBRL & HTML
- SalesForce, SAP, SharePoint, Intuit and Sage software
- Flowcharting and diagramming
```

Personal Skills
```
- Problem Solving
- Creative
- Excellent oral and written communication skills
- Excellent analytical, quantitative, and investigative skills
- Good at Project and Time management
- Detail oriented
```

### Professional Experience
#### Business Analyst
```
@ Sequoia Benefits, San Mateo, CA    AUG. 2014 - NOV. 2014
- Collected, maintained, analyzed, and justified aggregated client data
  using Excel, SQL, and Microsoft Access
- Performed financial analysis and devised recommendations for the customers
  based on the underlying data from multiple sources
- Organized and monitored project progress with the continuous support and
  response to ad hoc requests
- Developed interactive dashboards representing data schematics using
  Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Access
- Implemented automated tools to improve data integrity and accuracy
- Developed a comprehensive training session for the office employees
  demonstrating functionality of the tools and their usage scenarios
- Participated in developing a relational database schema for the company
```

#### Financial Analyst (internship)
```
@ Cisco Systems, San Jose, CA    AUG. 2013 - DEC. 2013
- Performed financial analysis and business research of existing and potential
  Cisco corporate partners to evaluate financial performance and efficacy of partnerships
- Evaluated, analyzed, and justified financial statistics based on the publicly available data
- Executed and presented competitive, IPO, and enterprise value analysis
- Developed an advanced scalable financial evaluation and presentation tool
  utilizing Microsoft Excel and multiple distinct data sources
- Worked extensively in a team and individually to improve leadership, teamwork,
  and presentation skills
```

#### Financial Analyst
```
@ The Reinforced Concrete Structures Plant, Russia    DEC. 2005 – JAN. 2009
- Worked on budgets, plans, forecasts, quarterly and annual reports,
  and micro-economic analysis of production
- Worked on inventory accounting control and monitoring
- Analyzed and monitored pricing and cost strategy with the input of marketing and sales departments
- Created automation in Microsoft Excel to collaboration related to financial data analysis
```

### Projects, Awards and Achievements
```
@ 1ST PLACE AWARD ISACA Research Competition (SJSU)    NOVEMBER, 2013
- Judged by industry professionals from PWC and ISACA-Silicon Valley
- Performed research on “Privacy” with focus on ethical and legal issues and
  risks related to protection of privacy in social media
- Examined the responsibilities of the auditors in handling sensitive data
```
```
@ Audit of Information Systems: Accounts Receivable, Payable, Inventory (SJSU)    APRIL, 2014
- Analyzed complex data and extracted unusual items utilizing IDEA data analyzing software
- Identified the risks of the system by analyzing the structure and architecture of the data
```
```
@ Building HTML web pages (SJSU)    APRIL, 2014
- Used various HTML tags to create web pages with interactive UI functionality
- Learned guidelines for the effective web page design and element and attributes insertion
```
```
@ Extensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL)
- Prepared annual financial reports in XBRL format
```


### Education
#### B.S. Degree in Business Administration with Honors (Accounting Information Systems) 4.0 GPA  
- GPA: 4.0 (yes, really)  
- President's List  
- Dean's List  
```
@ San Jose State University, San Jose, CA    AUG. 2010 - JULY 2014

Related coursework:
- Audit of Information Systems and Risk Assessment
- Advanced Accounting Information Systems
- Systems Development, Management of Information Business Systems
- Financial/Managerial/Intermediate Accounting, Corporate Financial Management
- Strategic Management, Taxes, Quantitative Business Analysis
```
